name: TheAtlantic
text: "What military leaders understand—and those advocating for our military to use its popularity to wade into politics do not—is that once the military consents to become a political actor, the public will consider it one," @KoriSchake writes. https://t.co/XCBC0z3JZ7

name: TheAtlantic
text: GOP leaders sold a female-friendly version of Donald Trump at the convention, despite dark parts of the president’s history, @emmaogreen reports: https://t.co/YgMczF6mn9

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As bad as the pandemic is, the city has seen more terrible days: in the Great Depression, in the draft riots of the Civil War—even in the Revolution, when a third of the city burned," @bakerauthor writes: https://t.co/VrGDJ0yjzf

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Trump administration has committed hundreds of millions of dollars to a newly authorized rapid COVID-19 test. @alexismadrigal talked with the lead scientist making it about the big questions experts have raised about the new technology. https://t.co/MNsw2cn5JD

name: TheAtlantic
text: "What I saw inside 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue today should raise alarm," @peteratlantic writes: https://t.co/gkWWsdthXi

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The most famous address in America now feels like a coronavirus breeding ground," writes @PeterAtlantic of his day inside the White House: https://t.co/pgt4bRPiFq

name: TheAtlantic
text: “For a president who narrates his fleeting thoughts, Donald Trump has been conspicuously silent about one looming question." @PeterAtlantic on Trump’s blank vision for a second term. https://t.co/2l7pvGMqzz

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos: The Aftermath of Hurricane Laura via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/TcIVc0ofHX

name: TheAtlantic
text: Hurricanes, wildfires, poisoned air, treacherous winds. How long, @yayitsrob asks, until the late summer and early fall is known as a time of disaster?https://t.co/r6BOMmNkgk

name: TheAtlantic
text: Michael Steele, the only Black person to chair the RNC, doesn't buy Trump's attempts to persuade voters he's not racist: It's "just not believable." @emmaogreen reports: https://t.co/wDqeJUjI22

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @emmaogreen: I talked to Michael Steele, the only Black person to ever chair the RNC, about what he thinks of Trump's overt attempts at the RNC to convince voters he is not racist.

It's “just not believable," Steele said.

https://t.co/1Uf2qtZVIv

name: TheAtlantic
text: What happens when the swashbuckling freedom fantasies of earlier eras grow up? @condorgoodwing on Héctor Tobar’s reinvention of the road novel: https://t.co/1Y8XaCjfZc

name: TheAtlantic
text: If it seems like there's a new viral video every day of a grown-up throwing a tantrum, writes @kait_tiffany, that's because there is. https://t.co/EEnB1Q0TUy

name: TheAtlantic
text: "At 17, Rittenhouse has never known a world where owning a gun did not go along with what is sometimes known as the 'sheepdog mentality'—the belief that your gun exists to protect others, and that you should rush in to perform that duty," @gcaw writes: https://t.co/UWsB3LzGK2

name: TheAtlantic
text: When @PeterAtlantic arrived at the White House yesterday morning, he was struck by the lack of coronavirus safety protocols in place: “The vibe was shockingly lax.” https://t.co/JJRqpD128D

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As the Republican National Convention has vividly illustrated, the GOP has morphed into the Party of Trump, and Republican foreign policy will likely have to reckon with Trumpism for years to come," @thomaswright08 writes: https://t.co/tvC0HUyQWX

name: TheAtlantic
text: At the RNC, Donald Trump was presented not just as a great president, but as a quasi-messianic figure who was single-handedly preventing the nation’s slide into anarchy. It was a post-truth convention, @mckaycoppins writes: https://t.co/I9h4Ufgrju

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @mckaycoppins: Americans who tuned into the Republican National Convention were treated to a slickly produced, four-day dispatch from Donald Trump's alternate reality. 

My story on the carnival of propaganda: https://t.co/r4I7BrSYqs

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump regards himself as a wartime president of Red America against Blue America. That’s how he can describe riot and disorder as happening in 'Biden’s America,' even when it happens under his presidency," @davidfrum writes: https://t.co/LNYVj9cI46

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Trump supporters define the term ‘corruption’ less as the violation of America’s laws than as the violation of America’s traditional hierarchies,” @PeterBeinart writes: https://t.co/oQPdveh2ZE

name: TheAtlantic
text: For millions of families, this fall brings no familiar demarcation when the kids leave, entrusted to the care of others for much of the day. That break in tradition only adds to the stress of the pandemic, @jandersonQZ reports: https://t.co/scVnDFmsGA

name: TheAtlantic
text: This summer, @brdemuth shared an ominous trait with Siberia: Their temperatures both hit 100.4 degrees Fahrenheit. https://t.co/FueHbssPwR
